page.title: 06Changes on Threave Island
page.content: A big change has been carried out on Threave Island, since Threave Castle was built on it, in 1369. The Castle was owned by the third Earl of Douglas, but now it belongs to the National Trust of Scotland. The island used to be a place of noise and anger, but now it is a quiet ruin. It has been discovered that an earlier castle lies underneath the grass, east of the later Douglas Tower house. No work has been done to uncover this hidden castle. Nowadays the moat is no longer filled with water as it has been drained out. Threave Island stands in the middle of the River Dee and lots of tourists come to visit the Island and Castle.
